title: Cedants creating two-tier reinsurance market: S&P
content:
Recent news: Fears of $2bn-$3bn Tianjin loss mount   
 7 September 2015  
 
Ceding tactics amongst global insurance carriers are diverging but
they are increasingly differentiating between top tier and
second-tier reinsurance carriers, Standard & Poor's
(S&P) said in a report on their ceding strategies. 

The agency noted varying buying trends, from those seeking out
aggregate covers to reducing retentions or buying more cover for
major disasters. 
 
Some buyers preferred to keep a smaller reinsurance panel while
others favoured dealing with a wide range of counterparties.
